item.description:
(from the New England Conservatory's website)

Music of Japan: Elizabeth Reian Bennett, Shakuhachi

Presented by NEC's Intercultural Institute. The first woman to be certified a Grand Master of the shakuhachi and one of only a handful of Western players trained in traditional Japanese music. Elizabeth Reian Bennett has studied and performed with Aoki Reibo, recognized as Japan's foremost traditional shakuhachi master, for 25 years.

DIRECTIONS

Subway: Take the Green Line "E" train to the Symphony stop. Walk one block west on Huntington Avenue, towards the YMCA. Take the first left, onto Gainsborough Street. Jordan Hall is on the right. Note: this station is not wheelchair accessible.

or

Take the Orange Line to Massachusetts Avenue station. Exit the station via the covered end of the platform and take a left onto Massachusetts Avenue. Walk to the first set of lights, at St. Botolph Street. Take a left onto St. Botolph Street and walk to the end of the block. Jordan Hall is located diagonally on the right. Note: this station is wheelchair accessible.

Bus: Convenient buses include #1, #CT1, and #39.

Cost: This concert is free!

It is also in Brown Hall. To get to Brown Hall, go inside 290 Huntington Avenue. Take a right. When you reach the end of the building, take a left.
item.name: ~ Shakuhachi Concert ~
